sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the Imperative negation (particle).

revisionDesc.change: For EGY-___ there are no values found
updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Generally used, although the variants verb +š and wala+imperative verb are also common in Haifa. The variant verb +š is considered "rural" and "unpolite" so many speakers avoid it. The variant wala+imperative verb is mainly used mainly by Christians (but also less frequently by Muslims and Jewish) in order to avoid any variant containing +š. (Geva-Kleinberger 2004:124)

The variant verb +š is considered "rural" and "unpolite" so many speakers avoid it. Generally used is the variant ma+verb+š. The variant wala+imperative verb is mainly used mainly by Christians (but also less frequently by Muslims and Jewish) in order to avoid any variant containing -š. (Geva-Kleinberger 2004:124)

The variant wala+imperative verb is mainly used mainly by Christians (but also less frequently by Muslims and Jewish) in order to avoid any variant containing -š. Generally used is the variant ma+verb+š. The variant verb +š is considered "rural" and "unpolite" so many speakers avoid it. (Geva-Kleinberger 2004:124)
Note that the verb keeps the indicative marker b-.

cit.quote: Do not go to him anymore!
Do not look at the mistakes!
He told him: Do not be afraid!

wib:featureValueObservation.note: This type of negation is quite archaic

"ba: occurs in the negative imperative structure in FD, it gives the meaning of a warning or a threat to the listener not to do so, from which the listener understands that if he does, he will be severely punished." (Alfaifi 2016: 150)

cit.quote: Don't (sg.f.) forget to turn off the lights
Do not come to see us
ne t‘immisce en rien dans cette affaire

wib:featureValueObservation.note: More emphatic than NEG with mā-š.
Difference between NEG of imperative and indicative only by intonation.

cit.quote: don't repeat the same things you often say
Don't (m.s.) wake the teacher until dawn.
lā tigul l-aḥadan ʔin maʕānā zalaṭ
Don't (2.p.s.m.)tell anybody that we have money.
